field.name: SWRSTSD
field.description: Software reset for Serial Flash domain

enumeratedValue.description: No action

Serial Flash domain flops are reset. Does not reset configuration registers. It is advisable to reset both the serial flash domain and AHB domain at the same time. Resetting only one domain might lead to side effects. The software resets need the clock to be running to propagate to the design. The MCR[MDIS] should therefore be set to 0 when the software reset bits are asserted. Also, before they can be deasserted again (by setting MCR[SWRSTSD] to 0), it is recommended to set the MCR[MDIS] bit to 1. Once the software resets have been deasserted, the normal operation can be started by setting the MCR[MDIS] bit to 0

field.name: SWRSTHD
field.description: Software reset for AHB domain

enumeratedValue.description: No action

AHB domain flops are reset. Does not reset configuration registers. It is advisable to reset both the serial flash domain and AHB domain at the same time. Resetting only one domain might lead to side effects. The software resets need the clock to be running to propagate to the design. The MCR[MDIS] should therefore be set to 0 when the software reset bits are asserted. Also, before they can be deasserted again (by setting MCR[SWRSTHD] to 0), it is recommended to set the MCR[MDIS] bit to 1. Once the software resets have been deasserted, the normal operation can be started by setting the MCR[MDIS] bit to 0

field.name: END_CFG
field.description: Defines the endianness of the QSPI module.For more details refer to Byte Ordering Endianess

field.name: DQS_OUT_EN
field.description: This field is valid when Data Strobe is also used as an output from controller during Write data phase

enumeratedValue.description: DQS as an output from controller is disabled
DQS as an output from controller is enabled

field.name: DQS_LAT_EN
field.description: DQS Latency Enable:\n This field is valid when latency is included in between read access from FLash in case when QSPI_MCR[DQS_EN] is 1

enumeratedValue.description: DQS Latency disabled
DQS feature with latency included enabled

field.name: DQS_EN
field.description: DQS enable:\n This field is valid for both SDR and DDR mode

enumeratedValue.description: DQS disabled

DQS enabled. When enabled, the incoming data is sampled on both the edges of DQS input when QSPI_MCR[DDR_EN] is set, else, on only one edge when QSPI_MCR[DDR_EN] is 0. The QSPI_SMPR[DDR_SMP] values are ignored

field.name: DDR_EN
field.description: DDR mode enable

enumeratedValue.description: 2x clock are disabled for SDR instructions only
2x clock are enabled supports both SDR and DDR instruction

field.name: VAR_LAT_EN
field.description: This field is used to enable variable latency feature in the controller

enumeratedValue.description: Fixed latency: Twice + 1 latency enable
Variable latency: 'once' or 'twice + 1' the initial latency based on Data strobe during CA phase. If enabled also need to ensure QSPI_FLSHCR[TCSS] must be >= 2

field.name: CLR_RXF
field.description: Clear RX FIFO. Invalidates the RX Buffer. This is a self-clearing field

enumeratedValue.description: No action
Read and write pointers of the RX Buffer are reset to 0. QSPI_RBSR[RDBFL] is reset to 0

field.name: CLR_TXF
field.description: Clear TX FIFO/Buffer. Invalidates the TX Buffer content. This is a self-clearing field

enumeratedValue.description: No action
Read and write pointers of the TX Buffer are reset to 0. QSPI_TBSR[TRCTR] is reset to 0

field.name: MDIS
field.description: Module Disable

enumeratedValue.description: Enable QSPI clocks
Allow external logic to disable QuadSPI clocks

field.name: DOZE
field.description: Doze Enable

enumeratedValue.description: A doze request will be ignored by the QuadSPI module
A doze request will be processed by the QuadSPI module

field.name: ISD2FA
field.description: Idle Signal Drive IOFA[2] Flash A

enumeratedValue.description: IOFA[2] is driven to logic L
IOFA[2] is driven to logic H

field.name: ISD3FA
field.description: Idle Signal Drive IOFA[3] Flash A

enumeratedValue.description: IOFA[3] is driven to logic L
IOFA[3] is driven to logic H

field.name: ISD2FB
field.description: Idle Signal Drive IOFB[2] Flash B

enumeratedValue.description: IOFB[2] is driven to logic L
IOFB[2] is driven to logic H

field.name: ISD3FB
field.description: Idle Signal Drive IOFB[3] Flash B

enumeratedValue.description: IOFB[3] is driven to logic L
IOFB[3] is driven to logic H

field.name: SCLKCFG
field.description: Serial Clock Configuration

field.name: IDATSZ
field.description: IP data transfer size. Defines the data transfer size in bytes of the IP command

field.name: SEQID
field.description: Points to a sequence in the Look-up table

field.name: TCSS
field.description: Serial flash CS setup time in terms of serial flash clock cycles

field.name: TCSH
field.description: Serial flash CS hold time in terms of serial flash clock cycles

field.name: TDH
field.description: Serial flash data in hold time

enumeratedValue.description: Data aligned with the posedge of Internal reference clock of QuadSPI
Data aligned with 2x serial flash half clock

field.name: MSTRID
field.description: Master ID

field.name: ADATSZ
field.description: AHB data transfer size

field.name: HP_EN
field.description: High Priority Enable

field.name: MSTRID
field.description: Master ID

field.name: ADATSZ
field.description: AHB data transfer size

field.name: MSTRID
field.description: Master ID

field.name: ADATSZ
field.description: AHB data transfer size

field.name: MSTRID
field.description: Master ID

field.name: ADATSZ
field.description: AHB data transfer size

field.name: ALLMST
field.description: All master enable

field.name: SEQID
field.description: Points to a sequence in the Look-up-table

field.name: SOCCFG
field.description: SOC Configuration For details, refer to chip-specific QuadSPI information

field.name: TPINDX0
field.description: Top index of buffer 0

field.name: TPINDX1
field.description: Top index of buffer 1

field.name: TPINDX2
field.description: Top index of buffer 2

field.name: SFADR
field.description: Serial Flash Address. The register content is used as byte address for all following IP Commands

field.name: CAS
field.description: Column Address Space

field.name: WA
field.description: Word Addressable

enumeratedValue.description: Byte addressable serial flash mode
Word (2 byte) addressable serial flash mode

field.name: FSPHS
field.description: Full Speed Phase selection for SDR instructions

enumeratedValue.description: Select sampling at non-inverted clock
Select sampling at inverted clock

field.name: FSDLY
field.description: Full Speed Delay selection for SDR instructions. Select the delay with respect to the reference edge for the sample point valid for full speed commands

enumeratedValue.description: One clock cycle delay
Two clock cycles delay

field.name: RDBFL
field.description: RX Buffer Fill Level

field.name: RDCTR
field.description: Read Counter

field.name: WMRK
field.description: RX Buffer Watermark

field.name: RXBRD
field.description: RX Buffer Readout. This field specifies the access scheme for the RX Buffer readout

enumeratedValue.description: RX Buffer content is read using the AHB Bus registers QSPI_ARDB0 to QSPI_ARDB31. For details, refer to Exclusive Access to Serial Flash for AHB Commands
RX Buffer content is read using the IP Bus registers QSPI_RBDR0 to QSPI_RBDR31

field.name: TRBFL
field.description: TX Buffer Fill Level

field.name: TRCTR
field.description: Transmit Counter

field.name: TXDATA
field.description: TX Data On write access the data is written into the next available entry of the TX Buffer and the QPSI_TBSR[TRBFL] field is updated accordingly

field.name: WMRK
field.description: Determines the watermark for the TX Buffer

field.name: BUSY
field.description: Module Busy

field.name: IP_ACC
field.description: IP Access. Asserted when transaction currently executed was initiated by IP bus

field.name: AHB_ACC
field.description: AHB Access. Asserted when the transaction currently executed was initiated by AHB bus

field.name: AHBGNT
field.description: AHB Command priority Granted: Asserted when another module has been granted priority of AHB Commands against IP Commands

field.name: AHBTRN
field.description: AHB Access Transaction pending

field.name: AHB0NE
field.description: AHB 0 Buffer Not Empty. Asserted when AHB 0 buffer contains data

field.name: AHB1NE
field.description: AHB 1 Buffer Not Empty. Asserted when AHB 1 buffer contains data

field.name: AHB2NE
field.description: AHB 2 Buffer Not Empty. Asserted when AHB 2 buffer contains data

field.name: AHB3NE
field.description: AHB 3 Buffer Not Empty. Asserted when AHB 3 buffer contains data

field.name: AHB0FUL
field.description: AHB 0 Buffer Full. Asserted when AHB 0 buffer is full

field.name: AHB1FUL
field.description: AHB 1 Buffer Full. Asserted when AHB 1 buffer is full

field.name: AHB2FUL
field.description: AHB 2 Buffer Full. Asserted when AHB 2 buffer is full

field.name: AHB3FUL
field.description: AHB 3 Buffer Full. Asserted when AHB 3 buffer is full

field.name: RXWE
field.description: RX Buffer Watermark Exceeded

field.name: RXFULL
field.description: RX Buffer Full

field.name: RXDMA
field.description: RX Buffer DMA. Asserted when RX Buffer read out via DMA is active i.e DMA is requested or running

field.name: TXEDA
field.description: Tx Buffer Enough Data Available

field.name: TXWA
field.description: TX Buffer watermark Available

field.name: TXDMA
field.description: TXDMA

field.name: TXFULL
field.description: TX Buffer Full. Asserted when no more data can be stored

field.name: TFF
field.description: IP Command Transaction Finished Flag

field.name: IPGEF
field.description: IP Command Trigger during AHB Grant Error Flag

field.name: IPIEF
field.description: IP Command Trigger could not be executed Error Flag

field.name: IPAEF
field.description: IP Command Trigger during AHB Access Error Flag

field.name: ABOF
field.description: AHB Buffer Overflow Flag

field.name: AIBSEF
field.description: AHB Illegal Burst Size Error Flag

field.name: AITEF
field.description: AHB Illegal transaction error flag

field.name: ABSEF
field.description: AHB Sequence Error Flag

field.name: RBDF
field.description: RX Buffer Drain Flag

field.name: RBOF
field.description: RX Buffer Overflow Flag

field.name: ILLINE
field.description: Illegal Instruction Error Flag

field.name: TBUF
field.description: TX Buffer Underrun Flag

field.name: TBFF
field.description: TX Buffer Fill Flag

register.name: RSER
register.description: Interrupt and DMA Request Select and Enable Register

field.name: TFIE
field.description: Transaction Finished Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.description: No TFF interrupt will be generated
TFF interrupt will be generated

field.name: IPGEIE
field.description: IP Command Trigger during AHB Grant Error Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.description: No IPGEF interrupt will be generated
IPGEF interrupt will be generated

field.name: IPIEIE
field.description: IP Command Trigger during IP Access Error Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.description: No IPIEF interrupt will be generated
IPIEF interrupt will be generated

field.name: IPAEIE
field.description: IP Command Trigger during AHB Access Error Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.description: No IPAEF interrupt will be generated
IPAEF interrupt will be generated

field.name: ABOIE
field.description: AHB Buffer Overflow Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.description: No ABOF interrupt will be generated
ABOF interrupt will be generated

field.name: AIBSIE
field.description: AHB Illegal Burst Size Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.description: No AIBSEF interrupt will be generated
AIBSEF interrupt will be generated

field.name: AITIE
field.description: AHB Illegal transaction interrupt enable

enumeratedValue.description: No AITEF interrupt will be generated
AITEF interrupt will be generated

field.name: ABSEIE
field.description: AHB Sequence Error Interrupt Enable: Triggered by ABSEF flags of QSPI_FR

enumeratedValue.description: No ABSEF interrupt will be generated
ABSEF interrupt will be generated

field.name: RBDIE
field.description: RX Buffer Drain Interrupt Enable: Enables generation of IRQ requests for RX Buffer Drain

enumeratedValue.description: No RBDF interrupt will be generated
RBDF Interrupt will be generated

field.name: RBOIE
field.description: RX Buffer Overflow Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.description: No RBOF interrupt will be generated
RBOF interrupt will be generated

field.name: RBDDE
field.description: RX Buffer Drain DMA Enable: Enables generation of DMA requests for RX Buffer Drain

enumeratedValue.description: No DMA request will be generated
DMA request will be generated

field.name: ILLINIE
field.description: Illegal Instruction Error Interrupt Enable. Triggered by ILLINE flag in QSPI_FR

enumeratedValue.description: No ILLINE interrupt will be generated
ILLINE interrupt will be generated

field.name: TBFDE
field.description: TX Buffer Fill DMA Enable

field.name: TBUIE
field.description: TX Buffer Underrun Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.description: No TBUF interrupt will be generated
TBUF interrupt will be generated

field.name: TBFIE
field.description: TX Buffer Fill Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.description: No TBFF interrupt will be generated
TBFF interrupt will be generated

field.name: SUSPND
field.description: When set, it signifies that a sequence is in suspended state

field.name: SPDBUF
field.description: Suspended Buffer: Provides the suspended buffer number. Valid only when SUSPND is set to 1'b1

field.name: DATLFT
field.description: Data left: Provides information about the amount of data left to be read in the suspended sequence

field.name: BFPTRC
field.description: Buffer Pointer Clear: 1: Clears the sequence pointer for AHB accesses as defined in QuadSPI_BFGENCR

field.name: IPPTRC
field.description: IP Pointer Clear: 1: Clears the sequence pointer for IP accesses as defined in QuadSPI_IPCR This is a self-clearing field

field.name: TPADA1
field.description: Top address for Serial Flash A1. In effect, TPADxx is the first location of the next memory

field.name: TPADA2
field.description: Top address for Serial Flash A2. In effect, TPxxAD is the first location of the next memory

field.name: TPADB1
field.description: Top address for Serial Flash B1.In effect, TPxxAD is the first location of the next memory

field.name: TPADB2
field.description: Top address for Serial Flash B2. In effect, TPxxAD is the first location of the next memory

field.name: RXDATA
field.description: RX Data

field.name: KEY
field.description: The key to lock or unlock the LUT. The KEY is 0x5AF05AF0. The read value is always 0x5AF05AF0

field.name: LOCK
field.description: Locks the LUT when the following condition is met: This register is written just after the LUTKEYLUT Key Register The LUT key register was written with 0x5AF05AF0 key

field.name: UNLOCK
field.description: Unlocks the LUT when the following two conditions are met: 1

field.name: OPRND0
field.description: Operand for INSTR0

field.name: PAD0
field.description: Pad information for INSTR0

enumeratedValue.description: 1 Pad
2 Pads
4 Pads
8 Pads

field.name: INSTR0
field.description: Instruction 0

field.name: OPRND1
field.description: Operand for INSTR1

field.name: PAD1
field.description: Pad information for INSTR1

field.name: INSTR1
field.description: Instruction 1
